Description: Film Studio: replaces Broadcast Center. +100% Tourism pressure from this city towards other civilizations starting from the Modern Era.
All Diplomatic policy slots in the current government are converted to Wildcard slots. +1 Diplomatic Favor per turn for each Wildcard slot in the current government.

P-51 Mustang: replaces Fighter. +5 Combat Strength against fighter aircraft. Gains 50% more experience. Higher Combat Strength (105 vs. 100) and Ranged Strength (105 vs. 100). Higher Movement (10 vs. 8).
Madrasa: replaces University and unlocked with Theology. +5 Science (1 more than university). Provides bonus Faith equal to the adjacency Science bonus of its district.
Automatically receives the final Great Prophet when the next-to-last one is claimed (unless one has already been earned through other means). +1 Science per foreign city following Arabia's Religion.

Mamluk: replaces Knight. Production cost increased from 180 to 220, Gold purchasing cost increased from 720 to 880, Gold maintenance cost increased from 3 to 4. Heals at the end of every turn, even if it moves or attacks.
Rainforest tiles provide a +1 adjacency bonus for Campus, Commercial Hub, Holy Site, and Theater Square districts, and provide +1 Appeal to adjacent tiles, instead of the usual -1.
Street Carnival: replaces Zoo. Lower Production cost (27 vs. 54). +2 Amenities (up from 1 for Zoo) from entertainment to parent city.
Minas Geraes: replaces Battleship and is unlocked with Nationalism. Higher Combat Strength (70 vs. 60). Higher Ranged Strength (80 vs. 70). Higher Anti-Air strength (95 vs. 90).
Eurekas and Inspirations provide an extra 10% of the Science and Culture cost for researching technologies and civics. Completing a Wonder grants a Eureka and Inspiration from that Wonder's era.

Great Wall: tile improvement. Can only be built in a line on the current border of your territory. Occupying unit receives +4 Defense Strength and automatically gains 2 turns of fortification (+6 Defense Strength). +2 Gold. +2 Gold for each adjacent Great Wall. +2 Culture for each adjacent Great Wall (with Castles). Can only be pillaged but never removed by disasters.
Crouching Tiger: unique ranged unit, unlocks with Machinery. High Ranged Strength (50). Has a ranged attack with Range 1.

Iron and Coal Mines accumulate +2 resources per turn. +100% Production towards Military Engineers. Military Engineers receive +2 charges. Buildings that provide additional yields when powered receive +4 of their respective yields. +20% Production towards Industrial Zone buildings. Harbor buildings grant +10 Strategic Resource stockpiles.

Unused: English unique district: Royal Navy Dockyard
Description: Royal Navy Dockyard: replaces Harbor. Lower Production cost (27 vs. 54). +1 Movement for all units built in Dockyard. +2 Gold when built on a foreign continent. +4 Loyalty when built on a foreign continent.
Sea Dog: replaces Privateer. Higher Ranged Strength (55 vs. 50). Can capture defeated enemy naval units. (Does not work for Barbarian or city-state ships.)

Sphinx: tile improvement. It can be built on any land tile, including Floodplains. +1 Culture. +1 additional Culture if built on Floodplains. +1 additional Culture (with Natural History). +2 Appeal. +1 Faith. +2 additional Faith if placed next to a Wonder. Cannot be adjacent to another Sphinx. Cannot be built on Snow or Snow Hills tiles.
15% Production towards districts and wonders built next to a River. Districts, improvements and units are immune to damage from floods.'

Unused: Egyptian unique unit: Maryannu Chariot Archer
Description: Maryannu Chariot Archer: replaces Heavy Chariot. +2 Movement when starting its turn on flat terrain with no Woods or Rainforests. Has a ranged attack (35 Ranged Strength, 2 Range). -17 Ranged Strength vs. District defenses and naval units.

Château: tile improvement. It must be built adjacent to a Bonus or a Luxury Resource. +2 Culture, +1 Gold, +1 Appeal. +1 Culture for each adjacent wonder, increasing to +2 Culture per wonder (with Flight). +2 Gold if built on a River. Cannot be adjacent to another Château.
Garde Impériale: replaces Line Infantry. Earns Great General points from kills. +10 Combat Strength on the original Capital Capital's home continent. Higher Combat Strength (70 vs. 65).
+20% Production towards Medieval, Renaissance and Industrial Era Wonders. Double Tourism from Wonders of any Era.

Hansa: replaces Industrial Zone. Lower Production cost (27 vs. 54). Major bonus (+2) for each adjacent Commercial Hub. Major bonus (+2) for each adjacent Aqueduct, Dam, or Canal. Standard bonus (+1) for each adjacent resource. Minor bonus (+½) for all other adjacent district tiles.
Each city can build one more specialty District than the Citizen Population limit would normally allow.
U-Boat: replaces Submarine. +10 Combat Strength when fighting on Ocean tiles. Higher Sight (3 vs. 2). Lower Production cost (430 vs. 480). No strategic resource requirement.

Acropolis: replaces Theater Square and can only be built on Hills. Standard bonus (+1 Culture) for each adjacent District (rather than 0.5 minor adjacency), +1 additional Culture if adjacent to a City Center. Awards 1 Envoy when completed.
Gains an additional Wildcard policy slot in all Governments.
Hoplite: replaces Spearman. +10 Combat Strength when adjacent to at least one other Hoplite. Higher Strength Combat Strength (28 vs. 25).

Indian cities receive the Follower Beliefs of all religions with at least one follower in them, not just the majority religion, and gain +1 Amenity for each religion with at least one follower in them. +2 Spread Religion charges for Missionaries. +100% Religious pressure from Indian Trade Routes.

Stepwell: tile improvement. Must be built on a flat land tile. +1 Housing, +1 Food. +1 additional Food if placed adjacent to a Farm. +1 additional Faith if placed adjacent to a Holy Site. +1 Faith (with Feudalism). +1 Housing (with Sanitation). +1 Food (with Professional Sports). Prevents Food Food loss from droughts. Cannot be adjacent to another Stepwell.
Varu: unique heavy cavalry. Ignores enemy zone of control. Reduces the Combat Strength of adjacent enemy units by 5 non-cumulatively.
Districts receive a +1 adjacency bonus for each adjacent district, instead of +0.5.
Electronics factory: Replaces Factory. +2 prod when powered over normal factory. +4 culture with electricity
Samurai: replaces man at arms. Does not suffer strength loss due to damage. Higher strength (48 vs 45)

Mbanza: replaces Neighborhood, must be built on Woods or Rainforest tiles and is unlocked with Guilds. Lower Production cost (27 vs. 54). +5 Housing, +2 Food, +4 Gold. Yield does not change based on the tile's Appeal.

Relics, Artifacts and Sculptures grant +2 Food, +2 Production, +1 Faith, and +4 Gold. The Palace has four extra slots for Great Works. +50% Great Artist, Great Musician, and Great Merchant points gained from all sources.

Ngao Mbeba: replaces Swordsman. Does not suffer Movement or sight penalties in Woods or Rainforests. +10 Combat Strength when defending against ranged attacks. Higher Combat Strength (38 vs. 35). Higher Production cost (110 vs. 90).
Stave Church: replaces Temple. Holy Site gets an additional standard adjacency bonus (+1) from Woods. +1 Production for every coastal resource worked by the city.

Norwegian units gain the ability to enter Ocean tiles with Shipbuilding, instead of Cartography, and pay no additional Movement costs to embark or disembark. Naval melee units can heal in neutral territory.

Berserker: replaces Man-At-Arms and is unlocked with Military Tactics. +2 Movement when starting its turn in enemy territory. +10 Combat Strength when attacking. -5 Combat Strength when defending against melee attacks. Higher Combat Strength (48 vs. 45).

Founded or conquered cities start with a Trading Post and, if within Trade Route range of the Capital Capital, a road to it. Trade Routes generate +1 additional Gold from Roman Trading Posts they pass through.
Bath: replaces Aqueduct district. Lower Production Production cost (18 vs. 36). Provides an additional bonus of +2 Housing and +1 Amenity.

Legion: replaces Swordsman. Has 1 build charge. Can construct a Roman Fort. (Consumes build charge.) Can clear terrain. (Consumes build charge.) Higher Combat Strength (40 vs. 35). Higher Production cost (110 vs. 90).

Lavra: Replaces Holy Site. Lower Production Production cost (27 vs. 54) +1 Great Prophet points/turn over Holy Site, +1 Great Writer point/turn w/ Shrine, +1 Great Artist point/turn w/ Temple, +1 Great Musician point/turn w/ worship building. Expands city borders whenever a Great Person is used.

Founded cities start with five additional tiles. Tundra tiles provide +1 Faith and +1 Production, in addition to their usual yields. Districts, improvements and units are immune to damage from Blizzards. +100% damage from Blizzards inside Russian territory to civilizations at war with Russia.

Cossack: Light cavalry, replaces cavalry. +5 Strength Combat Strength when fighting in or next to home territory. Can move after attacking. Higher Production cost (340 vs. 330). Higher Combat Strength (67 vs. 62).
Building a light cavalry unit or Saka Horse Archer grants a free second copy of that unit.

Kurgan: tile improvement. +1 Faith, +3 Gold. +1 Faith for each adjacent Pasture, increasing to +2 Faith for each adjacent Pasture (with Stirrups). Provides Tourism equal to its Faith output with Flight. Cannot be built on Hills tiles.

Unused: Scythian unique unit: Saka Horse Archer
Description: Saka Horse Archer: unique ranged cavalry. Has a ranged attack with Range 1. Ignores enemy zone of control.

Mission: tile improvement. +2 Faith. +2 Faith additionally, 1 Food, 1 Production if on a different continent than your Capital. +1 Science for every adjacent Campus and Holy Site. +2 Science (requires Cultural Heritage). +2 Loyalty per turn for cities with a Mission next to the City Center and not on the original Capital's continent

May form Fleets and Armadas with Mercantilism, instead of Nationalism and Mobilization. Trade Routes receive 3 Gold, 2 Faith and 1 Production. Trade Routes between cities on different continents gain triple these yields. Cities not on your original Capital's continent receive 25% extra Production towards Districts and a Builder when founded.

Conquistador: replaces Musketman. +10 Combat Strength when escorting (or when within 1 tile of) a religious unit. Converts cities to Spain's majority Religion if it captures a city or is adjacent to the city when it is captured. Higher Combat Strength (58 vs. 55). Higher Production cost (250 vs. 240).
Capturing a Barbarian Outpost also grants a Tribal Village reward. Levying city-state units costs 50% less Gold.
Ziggurat: tile improvement, available without any technological research. +2 Science. +1 Culture if placed adjacent to a River. +1 Culture (with Natural History). Cannot be built on Hills tiles.

War-Cart: unique heavy cavalry, available without any technological research. Strongest of the starting units in the game (30 Combat Strength, 3 Movement, 2 Sight). No combat penalties against anti-cavalry units. +1 Movement when starting its turn on flat terrain with no Woods or Rainforests. Ignores enemy zone of control.

Tlachtli: replaces Arena. +2 Faith. +1 Great General point per turn. Lower Production cost (135 vs. 150). +2 Amenity from Entertainment (same as Arena). +2 Culture. +1 Tourism after developing the Conservation civic.
Can spend Builder charges to complete 20% of a district's Production cost.
Eagle Warrior: replaces Warrior. Can capture defeated enemy units, turning them into Builders for the Aztecs. Higher Combat Strength (28 vs. 20). Higher Production cost (65 vs. 40).

Kampung: tile improvement. It must be built on Coast or Lake tiles adjacent to sea resources. +1 Production. +1 Housing. +1 Food from every adjacent Fishing Boats. Provides Tourism from Food after researching Flight. +1 Housing (with Mass Production). +1 Production (with Civil Engineering).

Coast and Lake tiles provide a +0.5 adjacency bonus for Holy Site, Campus, Industrial Zone, and Theater Square districts. Entertainment Complexes built adjacent to a Coast or Lake tile provide +1 Amenity.

Jong: replaces Frigate and unlocked with Mercenaries. When in formation, +5 Combat Strength and shares its Movement with all units in the formation. No strategic resource requirement. Higher Movement (5 vs. 4). Higher Production cost (300 vs. 280).

Prasat: replaces Temple. +6 Faith (2 more than Temple). +0.5 Culture for every Citizen Population in this city. Provides 10 Tourism if the city has 10 or more Citizen Population, and 20 Tourism if the city has 20 or more Citizen Population after Flight is researched.

Cities with an Aqueduct receive +1 Amenity, and +1 Faith for every point of Citizen Population in the city. Farms receive +2 Food when adjacent to an Aqueduct, and +1 Faith when adjacent to a Holy Site.
Domrey: replaces Trebuchet. Can move and attack on the same turn. Exerts zone of control. Higher Combat Strength (40 vs. 35). Higher Bombard Strength (50 vs. 45).
Sukiennice: replaces Market. +4 Gold from domestic Trade Routes and +2 Production from international Trade Routes in addition to Market bonuses.
Building an Encampment or Fort triggers a Culture Bomb, claiming surrounding tiles. One Military policy slot in all governments is converted into a Wildcard policy slot.
Winged Hussar: replaces Cuirassier. Pushes back enemies if it does more damage than it takes when attacking. Defenders that cannot be pushed back take additional damage.

Nubian Pyramid: tile improvement. Must be built on Desert, Desert (Hills) or Desert Floodplains tiles. +2 Faith, +2 Food. +1 Food if adjacent to a City Center. +1 Science if adjacent to a Campus. +1 Gold if adjacent to a Commercial Hub. +1 Gold if adjacent to a Harbor. +1 Faith if adjacent to a Holy Site. +1 Production if adjacent to an Industrial Zone. +1 Culture if adjacent to a Theater Square.
+30% Production toward Ranged units. Ranged units gain +50% combat experience. +1 Production for Mines over strategic resources, and +2 Gold for Mines over bonus and luxury resources.
Pítati Archer: replaces Archer. Higher Combat Strength (17 vs. 15). Higher Ranged Strength (30 vs. 25). Higher Movement (3 vs. 2). Higher Production cost (70 vs. 60).
Basilikoi Paides: replaces Barracks. Gain Science equal to 25% of the unit's cost when a non-civilian unit is created in this city.
Conquering a city grants a free Eureka for each Encampment and Campus district in the conquered city and a free Inspiration for each Holy Site and Theater Square district.
Hypaspist: replaces Swordsman. +5 Combat Strength when besieging a District. Increased support bonus (3 vs. 2). Higher Combat Strength (38 vs. 35). Higher Production cost (100 vs. 90).

Pairidaeza: tile improvement. +1 Culture, +2 Gold, +1 Appeal. +1 Culture for every adjacent Holy Site and Theater Square. +1 Gold for every adjacent Commercial Hub and City Center. +1 Culture (with Diplomatic Service). Cannot be built on Tundra or Snow tiles or adjacent to another Pairidaeza.
Gains +1 Trade Route capacity with Political Philosophy. Domestic Trade Routes provide +2 Gold and +1 Culture. Roads built inside Persian territory are one level more advanced than usual.

Immortal: replaces Swordsman. Has a ranged attack (25 Ranged Strength, 2 Range). Can still make melee attacks. -17 Ranged Strength against District defenses and Naval units. Higher Production cost (100 vs. 90).

Outback Station: tile improvement, must be built on flat Grassland, Plains, Desert, or Desert Hills tiles. +1 Food, +1 Production, +0.5 Housing, +1 Food from every adjacent Pasture, +1 Production to every adjacent Pasture (with Steam Power), +1 Production from every 2 adjacent Outback Stations (with Steam Power), +1 Food from every 2 adjacent Outback Stations (with Rapid Deployment)

+3 Housing in coastal cities. Building a Pasture triggers a Culture Bomb, claiming surrounding tiles. Campus, Commercial Hub, Holy Site, and Theater Square districts gain +1 to their yields in tiles with Charming Appeal, and +3 in tiles with Breathtaking Appeal.

Digger: replaces Infantry. +10 Strength Combat Strength on coastal tiles. +5 Strength Combat Strength outside Australian territory. Higher Strength Combat Strength (78 vs. 75). No strategic resource requirement.
Gains +1 Trade Route capacity and a free Trader with Pottery. Unclaimed tiles within three tiles of a Cree city come under Cree control when a Trader first moves into them.

Mekewap: tile improvement. Must be built adjacent to a Bonus or Luxury Resource. +1 Production, +1 Housing. +1 additional Production and Housing (with Civil Service). +1 Gold if adjacent to a Luxury Resource. +2 additional Gold for each adjacent Luxury Resource (with Cartography). +1 Food for every two adjacent Bonus Resources, increasing to +1 Food Food for each adjacent Bonus Resource (with Conservation). Cannot be adjacent to another Mekewap.
Okihtcitaw: replaces Scout. Starts with one free Promotion. Higher Production cost (40 vs. 30). Higher Combat Strength (20 vs. 10).
Tsikhe: replaces Renaissance Walls. Lower Production cost (260 vs. 300). +4 Faith. +200 Outer Defense Strength (100 more than Renaissance Walls). +100% Tourism and Faith while in a Golden Age.
Dedications chosen at the beginning of a Golden Age or Heroic Age also grant their Normal Age bonuses towards improving Era Score, in addition to their regular bonuses. +50% Production towards walls.
Khevsur: replaces Man-At-Arms . No Movement penalty in Hills. +7 Combat Strength when fighting in Hills. Higher Combat Strength (48 vs. 45).
Seowon: replaces the Campus and must be built on Hills. Lower Production Production cost (27 vs. 54). Has a starting adjacency bonus of +4 Science. -1 Science for each adjacent District.
Farms receive +1 Food and Mines receive +1 Science for each adjacent Seowon.

Hwacha: replaces Field Cannon. Unlocked with Gunpowder rather than Ballistics. Cannot attack after moving unless its maximum Movement is 3 or more. Lower Production cost (250 vs. 330). Lower Combat Strength (45 vs. 50, ranged is same at 60). Lower Gold maintenance cost (3 vs. 5).
Chemamull: tile improvement. Must be built on a tile with an Appeal of Breathtaking (4 or more). +1 Production. Provides Culture equal to 75% of its tile's Appeal.

Cities with an established Governor gain +5% Culture, +5% Production, and +10% combat experience towards all units trained in the city. These numbers are tripled in cities not founded by the Mapuche. All cities within 9 tiles of a city with your Governor gain +4 Loyalty per turn towards your civilization.
Malón Raider: unique light cavalry. +5 Combat Strength within 4 tiles of friendly territory. Pillaging only costs 1 Movement. Ignores enemy zone of control.
Ordu: replaces Stable. +1 Movement for all cavalry units trained in this city.

Sending a Trade Route immediately creates a Trading Post in the destination city, instead of when the Trade Route is completed. Gains an extra level of Diplomatic Visibility with civilizations that have a Mongolian Trading Post. +6 Combat Strength for all units for each level of Diplomatic Visibility Mongolia has over the other civilization, instead of the usual +3 Combat Strength.
Keshig: unique ranged cavalry. High Movement. Ignores enemy zone of control. Has a ranged attack with Range 2. When in formation, shares its Movement with all units in the formation.

Rivers provide a +2 adjacency bonus for Campus, Theater Square, and Industrial Zone districts. Building a Harbor triggers a Culture Bomb, claiming surrounding tiles. +50% Production towards the Dam district and Flood Barrier building.

Polder: tile improvement. It must be built on Coast or Lake tiles with at least three adjacent non-Mountain land tiles. +1 Food. +1 Food for every adjacent Polder, increasing to +2 Food for each adjacent Polder (with Replaceable Parts). +1 Production. +0.5 Housing. +4 Gold (with Civil Engineering). +1 Production for every adjacent Polder (with Replaceable Parts). Increases Movement cost of tile to 3.
De Zeven Provinciën: replaces Frigate. +7 Ranged Strength when attacking defensible Districts. Higher Combat Strength (50 vs. 45). Higher Ranged Strength (60 vs. 55).

Golf Course: tile improvement. +2 Amenities, +2 Gold, +1 Appeal. +1 Culture if adjacent to a City Center. +1 Culture if adjacent to an Entertainment Complex. +1 Housing (with Globalization). Cannot be built on Desert or Desert Hills tiles. Limit of one per city. Tiles with Golf Courses cannot be swapped.

Happy cities gain +5% Science and +5% Production, and generate +1 Great Scientist points in their Campuses and +1 Great Engineer points in their Industrial Zones. Ecstatic cities double these bonuses.
Highlander: replaces Ranger. +5 Combat Strength in Hills and Woods. Exerts zone of control. Higher Combat Strength (50 vs. 45). Higher Ranged Strength (65 vs. 60).

Ikanda: replaces Encampment. Lower Production cost (27 vs. 54). +1 Housing. 25% faster training of Corps and Armies. Allows Corps and Armies to be built without the Military Academy building. Buildings in the Ikanda provide +2 Gold and +1 Science.
Impi: replaces Pikeman. Gains 50% more experience. Lower Production cost (125 vs. 200). Lower Gold maintenance cost (1 vs. 3). Increased flanking bonus (4 vs. 2).

Capturing a city will upgrade the conquering unit into a Corps or Army if the necessary civics are unlocked. +3 Loyalty per turn to cities with a garrisoned unit, increasing to +5 if the garrisoned unit is a Corps or Army.

Cannot declare Surprise Wars or war on city-states. Surprise Wars cannot be declared on Canada. For every 100 Tourism earned, gain 1 Diplomatic Favor. +100% Diplomatic Favor gained from successfully completing Emergencies or Scored Competitions.

Ice Hockey Rink: tile improvement. It must be built on Tundra, Tundra Hills, Snow, or Snow Hills tiles. +1 Amenity. +2 Appeal to surrounding tiles. +1 Culture for each adjacent Tundra, Tundra Hills, Snow, and Snow Hills tile. +2 Food and Production (with Professional Sports). +4 Culture if adjacent to a Stadium. Limit of one per city. Tiles with Ice Hockey Rinks cannot be swapped.

Mountie: unique light cavalry unit. Has Sight of 4. +5 Combat Strength when within 2 tiles of a National Park. +5 additional Combat Strength if the park is Canadian. Ignores enemy zone of control. Has 2 build charges. Can establish a National Park. (Consumes a build charge.)

Thermal Bath: replaces Zoo. +2 Amenities (1 more than Zoo) from entertainment to all City Centers within 6 tiles. +2 Production to all City Centers within 6 tiles. +3 Tourism and +2 additional Amenities to this city if there is at least one Geothermal Fissure within its borders. No bonus science to rainforests or marsh as with standard Zoo.
+50% Production for districts and buildings built across a river from a City Center.'
Huszár: replaces Cavalry. +3 Combat Strength for every active Alliance. Higher Combat Strength (65 vs. 62). Higher Production cost (335 vs. 330).

Citizens may work Mountain tiles. Mountain tiles provide +2 Production, and +1 Food for each adjacent Terrace Farm. Mountain tiles provide an additional +1 Production when Inca reaches the Industrial Era.

Terrace Farm: tile improvement. Available without any technological research and must be built on Grassland Hills, Plains Hills, Desert Hills or Volcanic Soil tiles. +1 Food, +1 Housing. +1 Food for each adjacent Mountain. +2 Production for each adjacent Aqueduct. +1 Production if adjacent to Fresh Water and not an Aqueduct.
Warak'aq: replaces Skirmisher. Can make 1 additional attack per turn if Movement allows. Higher Production cost (165 vs. 150). Higher Ranged Strength (40 vs. 30).
Suguba: replaces Commercial Hub. Lower Production cost (27 vs. 54). Major bonus (+2 Gold) for a nearby Holy Site (instead of Harbour). 20% discount on all Gold and Faith purchases in this city.

City Centers receive +1 Faith and +1 Food for every adjacent Desert and Desert Hills tile. Mines receive -1 Production and +4 Gold. May purchase Commercial Hub buildings with Faith. -30% Production towards buildings and units.

Mandekalu Cavalry: replaces Knight. Prevents friendly Traders within 4 tiles from being plundered as long as they are on a land tile. Provides Gold equal to 100% of the base Strength Combat Strength of each defeated enemy unit. Higher Combat Strength (55 vs. 50).

Marae: replaces Amphitheater. +1 Culture and Faith to all of this city's tiles with a passable feature. +1 Tourism to all of this city's tiles with a feature (with Flight). No maintenance cost. 
No Great Work slots.

Pā: built by the Toa and must be on a Hills tile. Occupying unit receives +4 Defense Strength and automatically gains 2 turns of fortification (+6 Defense Strength). A Māori unit occupying a Pā heals even if it just moved or attacked.

Starts with Sailing and Shipbuilding unlocked and the ability to enter Ocean tiles. +5 Combat Strength and +2 Movement for embarked units. Unimproved Woods and Rainforests grant +1 Production, increasing to +2 Production with Mercantilism and +3 Production with Conservation. +1 Food from Fishing Boats. Building a Fishing Boat triggers a Culture Bomb, claiming surrounding tiles. Resources cannot be harvested. Great Writers cannot be earned.

Toa: replaces Swordsman. Reduces the Strength Combat Strength of adjacent enemy units by 5 (non-cumulatively). Has 1 build charge. Can construct a Pā. Can clear terrain. Higher Production cost (120 vs. 90). No Gold maintenance cost. Higher Combat Strength (38 vs. 35). No strategic resource requirement.

Grand Bazaar: replaces Bank. Lower Production Production cost (220 vs. 290). Accumulate one extra Strategic resource for every different type of Strategic resources this city has improved. Receive 1 Amenity for every type of Luxury resource this city has improved.

+30% Production toward Siege units. Siege units gain +5 Combat Strength when attacking defensible districts. Conquering a city doesn't cause that city to lose Citizen Population. +1 Amenity and +4 Loyalty per turn for cities not founded by the Ottomans.
Barbary Corsair: replaces Privateer and is unlocked with Medieval Faires. Uses no Movement to perform coastal raids. Lower Production cost (240 vs. 280). Lower Gold maintenance cost (3 vs. 4).

Cothon: replaces Harbour district. Lower Production cost (27 vs. 54). +50% Production towards naval units and Settlers in this city. All wounded naval units in the city's borders heal +100 HP each turn.

Starts with the Eureka for Writing. Coastal cities founded by Phoenicia and in the same continent as their Capital always have full Loyalty. Settlers receive +2 Movement and Sight while embarked, and pay no Movement costs to embark or disembark.
Bireme: replaces Galley. Prevents friendly Traders within 4 tiles from being plundered as long as they are on a water tile. Higher Combat Strength (35 vs. 30). Higher​​ Movement (4 vs. 3).

Open-Air Museum: tile improvement. +2 Loyalty per turn in this city. +2 Culture and +2 Tourism for each type of terrain (Snow, Tundra, Desert, Plains, or Grassland) in which at least one Swedish city is founded. Limit of one per city. Tiles with Open-Air Museums cannot be swapped.

Gains 50 Diplomatic Favor whenever a Great Person is earned. +1 Great Engineer points from Factories and +1 Great Scientist points from Universities. Sweden's presence in the game adds three unique World Congress competitions in the Industrial Era.
Carolean: replaces Pike and Shot. +3 Combat Strength per point of unused Movement. Higher Movement (3 vs. 2). Lower Gold maintenance cost (3 vs. 4).
Commandate General: _
+1 Movement for all units. Promoting a unit does not end that unit's turn.

Hacienda: tile improvement that must be built on Grassland, Grassland Hills, Plains or Plains Hills tiles. +2 Gold, +1 Production, +0.5 Housing. +1 Food from every two adjacent Plantations, increasing to +1 Food for each adjacent Plantation (with Replaceable Parts). Plantations and Haciendas receive +1 Production for every two adjacent Haciendas, increasing to +1 Production for each Hacienda (with Rapid Deployment).

Llanero: replaces Cavalry. +2 Strength Combat Strength for each adjacent Llanero. Regains all HP when in range of a Comandante General that uses its retire ability. Lower Gold maintenance cost (2 vs. 5).

Observatory: replaces Campus district. Lower Production cost (27 vs. 54). Major bonus (+2 Science) for every adjacent Plantation. Minor bonus (+½ Science) for every adjacent Farm or district. Does not receive adjacency bonus from Mountains, Reefs, or Geothermal Fissures.
Hul'che: replaces Archer. +5 Ranged Strength against wounded units. Higher Ranged Strength (28 vs. 25).

Cities do not receive additional Housing from being adjacent to fresh water or coast. Cities gain +1 Amenity for each Luxury Resource adjacent to the City Center. Farms grant +1 Housing, +1 Production if adjacent to an Observatory, and +1 Gold.

+3 Combat and Religious Strength for all units for each Holy City converted to Byzantium's Religion (including Byzantium's own Holy City). Byzantium's Religion is spread to nearby cities when a unit from an enemy civilization or city-state is defeated. +1 Great Prophet point from Holy Sites.

Hippodrome: replaces Entertainment Complex. Lower Production cost (27 vs. 54). +3 Amenities (2 more than Entertainment Complex). Provides a free heavy cavalry unit when first constructed and for each building constructed. These units require no resource to be created or maintain.
Dromon: replaces Quadrireme. +10 Combat Strength against land and naval units. Has a ranged attack with Range 2 (1 more than Quadrireme).

Oppidum: replaces Industrial Zone and is unlocked with Iron Working. Lower Production Production cost (27 vs. 54). Acquires Outer Defenses and Ranged Strike along with the City Center once Walls have been built. Unlocks Apprenticeship when the first Oppidum is built.

Mines gain +1 Culture, provide a +0.5 adjacency bonus for all districts and trigger a Culture Bomb when built, claiming surrounding unowned tiles. Specialty districts do not receive an adjacency bonus from other districts and cannot be built next to the City Center.
Gaesatae: replaces Warrior. +10 Combat Strength when fighting units with a higher base Combat Strength. +5 Combat Strength when fighting against District defenses. Higher Production cost (60 vs. 40).

Thành: replaces Encampment. Lower Production cost (27 vs. 54). +2 Culture for every adjacent District. Provides Tourism from Culture adjacency bonus after researching Flight. Is not considered a specialty District and does not require Citizen Population. Provides no Great General point.
Voi Chiến: replaces Crossbowman. Can move after attacking. Higher Combat Strength (35 vs. 30). Higher Movement (3 vs. 2). Higher Sight (3 vs. 2). Higher Production cost (200 vs. 180).

Land specialty Districts can only be built on Woods, Rainforest or Marsh tiles. Buildings on these features receive additional yields: +1 Culture in Woods, +1 Science in Rainforest, and +1 Production in Marsh. Can plant Woods with Medieval Faires, instead of Conservation.

Improved resource tiles receive +1 Faith for each copy of the resource the city owns. International Trade Routes grant +0.5 Faith for each resource in the origin city. Can purchase Archaeologists and Archaeological Museums with Faith.

Rock-Hewn Church: tile improvement, must be built on Hills or Volcanic Soil tiles. +1 Faith, +1 Appeal. +1 Faith for every adjacent Mountain and Hills tile. Provides Tourism from Faith after researching Flight. Can never be destroyed (only pillaged) by natural disasters. Cannot be adjacent to another Rock-Hewn Church.
Oromo Cavalry: replaces Courser. No Movement penalty in Hills. Higher Sight (3 vs. 2). Higher Combat Strength (48 vs. 46).
Eurekas instantly unlock their respective technologies. -50% Science per turn.
Palgum: replaces Water Mill. +2 Production . +1 Housing. +1 Food to all tiles adjacent to a source of Fresh Water. City must be adjacent to a River.

Sabum Kibittum: unique melee unit. It is available without any technological research. +5 Combat Strength vs. anti-cavalry units. +17 Combat Strength vs. heavy and light cavalry units. High Movement (3). High Sight (3).

Navigation School: replaces University. Same as univeristy plus +1 Great Admiral point, +25% Production to naval units and +1 Science from every two Coast or Lake tiles in the Navigation School's city.

Feitoria: Tile improvement, must be on a Coast or Lake tile adjacent to land and a bonus or luxury resource in the territory of another civilization or city-state with whom you have Open Borders. +4 Gold, +1 Production, +4 Gold and +1 Production to Portuguese Trade Routes to this city. Cannot be adjacent to another Feitoria. Cannot be removed.

International Trade Routes can only be sent to cities on the coast or with a Harbor, but gain a +50% increase to all yields. Traders have +50% range over water, and can embark as soon as they are unlocked.
Nau: replaces Caravel. Starts with one free promotion. Has 2 build charges. Can construct a Feitoria. Lower Gold maintenance cost (2 vs. 4).
